Abstract: Boris N Yeltsin unexpectedly resigns as president of Russia and names Prime Min Vladimir V Putin acting president until new president is elected on March 26; timing suggests to some observers that Yeltsin wants Putin elected before war in breakaway republic of Chechnya can begin to sour and erode his strong popularity; Putin, who remains prime minister, grants Yeltsin--but not his family--immunity from criminal or administrative investigations; photos (L)
Snippet: Boris N Yeltsin unexpectedly resigns as president of Russia and names Prime Min Vladimir V Putin acting president until new president is elected on March 26; timing suggests to some observers that Yeltsin wants Putin elected before war in breakawa...
LeadParagraph: Boris N. Yeltsin shocked his nation and the world today, announcing his resignation as president six months before the end of his term and handing over power to his favored successor, Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin.

Headline.Main: Yeltsin Resigns, Naming Putin as Acting President To Run in March Election
Headline.PrintHeadline: YELTSIN RESIGNS: THE OVERVIEW; Yeltsin Resigns, Naming Putin as Acting President To Run in March Election
